Comments_List: I have gained writing skills, public speaking skills, and the ability to manage a college workload.
I learned about the foundations of moral psychology and moral philosophy. I also learned more about what moral attitudes I hold and I enjoyed seeing how my moral ideas compared with my peers'.

The strengths included: Student-teacher interaction, expression of ideas, varied subjects of study, interesting coursework.

Weaknesses: Grading

I think that the TF, Julia Marshall, was stellar. If possible, the TF for this course should be just as experienced, knowledgeable, and efficient during conference calls as she was. 

The course could be improved by talking about concrete ways that the principles of moral philosophy/psychology have tangibly affected laws (religious or governmental).
Absolutely! I loved exploring big moral questions in an academic but not competitive, pressured, or judgmental environment.
